alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lake County through 445 PM MDT... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rocky Point, or over Polson, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Polson, Rocky Point, Jette, Kerr, Swan Lake, Turtle Lake, Kings Point, Pablo, Big Arm and Finley Point. This includes the following highways... Highway 83 between mile markers 59 and 72. Highway 93 between mile markers 53 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northwestern Montana.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; West Glacier Region
